div.p: Are you ready to celebrate another member of the class of 2020? Today let's give a shout out to senior Max Glasgow.

Q: How are you staying busy these days given the current situation?
A: I’ve been staying busy with concurrent work, video games, and stress eating.
Q: What was your most memorable senior moment?
A: Having the rest of my senior year cancelled because of a virus.
Q: What was the funniest thing that happened during your senior year?
A: All of my time spent at the college room round table.
Q: What was your greatest accomplishment in high school?
A: Having a GPA higher than a 4.0
Q: If you could do it all over again, what would you change in your high school career?
A: I would have spent more time in the weight room.
Q: What were the most difficult obstacles you had to overcome in high school?
A: Everyone thinking I’m privileged
Q: What advice would you give to future high school students?
A: Focus on keeping those A’s no matter what and join every extracurricular you can, your school needs you more than you think.
Q: What teacher/staff/coach(from any grade level) impacted you the most and why?
A: Mrs. Glasgow since she always made sure I was kept in line and was being the best I could be.
Q: What are your plans after high school?
A: To attend Oklahoma State University and major in Computer Science.
Q: Who would you like to say "thank you" to?
A: I would like to say thank you to my family, my teachers, and my classmates for making my high school experience so extraordinary.
Q: Is there anything else you'd like to add?
A: I am truly sad I won’t get to have a senior trip or a Prom my senior year.
Q: Favorite meal?
A: Macaroni and Cheese
Q: If you could be any animal what would you choose? and why?
A: I would be a Honey Badger, because Honey Badger don’t care.
Q: Your favorite superhero?
A: Black Panther, because of his infamous battle cry.
Time to celebrate another one of our awesome seniors! Today we want to give a big shout out to Kierra Evans.

Q: How are you staying busy these days given the current situation?
A: I’ve been doing my sisters’ hair and trying to learn Spanish.
Q: What was your most memorable senior moment?
A: Playing my first basketball game with Amaya and Carla.
Q: What was the funniest thing that happened during your senior year?
A: I don’t really have anything.
Q: What was your greatest accomplishment in high school?
A: Being a leader to the kids in school.
Q: If you could do it all over again, what would you change in your high school career?
A: I would focus more in class.
Q: What were the most difficult obstacles you had to overcome in high school?
A: Finding out who my real friends were.
Q: What advice would you give to future high school students?
A: Pay attention in class and listen to your teachers. They know what’s best.
Q: What teacher/staff/coach(from any grade level) impacted you the most and why?
A: Mrs. Bradford, because she helped me with whatever I needed. She made sure I did my work and had everything in on time.
Q: What are your plans after high school?
A: Go to college and get a degree in something!
Q: Who would you like to say "thank you" to?
A: Coach Shack, for sticking with me through everything.
Q: Favorite meal?
A: Chicken Alfredo
Q: If you could be any animal what would you choose? and why?
A: I would be a lion, because they are fierce.
Q: Your favorite superhero?
A: Deadpool
Keep those Shout-outs coming! It's day four and we want to celebrate senior Katie Baker.

Q: How are you staying busy these days given the current situation?
A: I am still working at Subway and on my days off I’m either doing homework or spending time with my Momma!
Q: What was your most memorable senior moment?
A: There’s so many, but I think what I’m going to miss most is sitting in the college room with Max, Gabe, and Jose and talking and laughing about random funny stuff.
Q: What was the funniest thing that happened during your senior year?
A: I think it would probably have to be when me, Gabe, and Mrs. Glasgow were testing a new game for the pep-assembly and Gabe was taped up and he needed help down to the ground and he pretty much did a trust fall with me, but I barely had him and I ended up just letting him fall to the ground. Me and Mrs. Glasgow laughed for a good five minutes!
Q: What was your greatest accomplishment in high school?
A: I think my greatest accomplishment would be how I kept all of my grades up and I took lots of concurrent classes.
Q: If you could do it all over again, what would you change in your high school career?
A: I wouldn’t change much. I think the only thing I would change is I would’ve tried to spend more time together with my class.
Q: What were the most difficult obstacles you had to overcome in high school?
A: :)It probably would have been learning to not care what people think of you. You just have to keep doing you. As long as you know what your doing is good, don’t let anyone try to bring you down or stop you!
Q: What advice would you give to future high school students?
A: Oh I have so much. Definitely take the ACT ASAP and start taking concurrent classes when you’re a junior. Also keep your grades up and don’t be lazy. And I promise you it will help to be on the teachers’ good side!
Q: What teacher/staff/coach(from any grade level) impacted you the most and why?
A: MRS.GLASGOW!!!!! I would NOT be where I am right now if it wasn’t for her!!! She helped me through so much and I owe it all to her! (and of course my wonderful mom)
Q: What are your plans after high school?
A: To attend SWOSU and get into the Pharmacy program! (I can’t wait!)
Q: Who would you like to say "thank you" to?
A: I want to say thank you to all of my teachers throughout my high school time. They all have taught me so much and I am so thankful for them! Definitely a huge thank you to Mrs. Glasgow too! Every question I have ever had she has been there to answer and if she didn’t know, she was working her butt off to find out! I also have to save the best for last... MY MOM!!! Boy oh boy…I could sit here and write forever just talking about how wonderful she is and how much she has helped me! I could be the meanest brat ever (which I never am😉) but as soon as I need something or needed her help she was right there at my every beckoning call! I really wouldn’t be where I am now if it wasn’t for her long life lectures almost every day. (My friends know these lectures too!) She’s my rock. I know if I ever need help I can always go to her. I just hope one day I can repay her for everything she has done for me.
Q: Is there anything else you'd like to add?
A: Hmmm not that I can think of..
Q: Favorite meal?
A: My moms chicken strip dinner! (or any of my mom’s cooking because it’s the BEST!)
Q: If you could be any animal what would you choose? and why?
A: Probably a bird, because I would love to be able to fly like them and see the world from their perspective.
Q: Your favorite superhero?
A: Does my mom count? Because she’s definitely a superhero in my eyes!

Time to celebrate another member of the class of 2020. Today we send a shout-out to senior Cameron Finney!
Q: How are you staying busy these days given the current situation? A: I’ve stayed busy by working. Q: What was your most memorable senior moment? A: Male Cheer, because I got to Tokyo Drift Q: What was the funniest thing that happened during your senior year? A: We had a class party and Greyson stayed up late . . .

h3.a: Wi-fi and Devices for Distance Learning

div.p: Just a few reminders about distance learning: 1) Free wi-fi is available outside any school building, outside the public library on Main Street, outside the Pioneer office in Geary, and now outside the Co-op in Greenfield! The Greenfield wi-fi does have a password so call the HS office (884-5606) between 8:30 and 12:00 to get that password. 2) If you need a device to access distance learning, each family can check out a . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Wi-fi and Devices for Distance Learning

div.p:
Since most schools in the nation are closed, some publishers have decided to give free access to their digital libraries for students and parents. Listed below are some recommended websites for free electronic books. Check them out!
Junior Library Guild - Fiction and Non-fiction for all grade levels. Click on the link below.
JLG @ Home
Abdo Books - Non-fiction for all grade levels. Click on . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Free Digital Book Subscriptions

h3.a: Virtual Leaning Guidelines for Students and Parents

div.p: Students in Oklahoma will not be able to return to the classroom due to the nationwide Coronavirus epidemic and the state-mandated closing of public school buildings. Geary Public Schools and other districts in the state are in the process of planning distance learning programs that will be implemented starting April 6. Teachers have been meeting through video conferencing to plan for this shift in instructional methods. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Virtual Leaning Guidelines for Students and Parents
